QuestionStem: Mangrove trees live in salty conditions that would kill most other types of plants. How do you think the mangrove tree is able to tolerate this environment?

options.AnswerText: A. The mangrove tree needs more salt than other plants to live.
B. The mangrove tree disposes of salt through its leaves.
C. Animals that live on the tree eat the salt from the tree.
D. The mangrove tree does not grow as well as trees that do not live in salty conditions.

CorrectFeedback: The mangrove disposes of the salt through its leaves.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Look back at how plants dispose of wastes.
IncorrectFeedback: Look back at how plants dispose of wastes.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: The mangrove disposes of the salt through its leaves.
